intro: Juanulloa panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian juanulloa, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly Panama. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in humid, lowland forests and is known for its ornamental value. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
